query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
1 Al tornar de la mente, che si chiuse 2 dinanzi a la pietà d’i due cognati, 3 che di trestizia tutto mi confuse,
4 novi tormenti e novi tormentati 5 mi veggio intorno, come ch’io mi mova 6 e ch’io mi volga, e come che io guati.
query.result:
**English:**
1 When my mind returned, which had closed 2 before the pity of the two brothers-in-law, 3 which had confused me all with sadness,
4 new torments and new tormented people 5 I see around me, no matter how I move, 6 and how I turn, and how I look.
**Cornish:**
1 Pan wosa'm spyrys ow thyski, ow a veu keffrys 2 rag an kethres, ow a veu keffrys 3 ow a veu keffrys, ow a veu keffrys,
4 nowyth tormentow ha nowyth tormentow 5 y'm gwelesow kolon, pyth vythfynn y'm kerdhes, 6 ha pyth vythfynn y'm trohes, ha pyth vythfynn y'm selwel.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
7 Io sono al terzo cerchio, de la piova 8 etterna, maladetta, fredda e greve; 9 regola e qualità mai non l’è nova.
query.result:
**English:**
7 I am in the third circle, of the rain 8 eternal, cursed, cold and heavy; 9 rule and quality are never new to it.
**Cornish:**
7 Y'm yn tresves renk, a'n glaw 8 bythveth, keffrysys, yen ha poos; 9 rewl ha anserghi na veu nowydh dhodho.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
10 Grandine grossa, acqua tinta e neve 11 per l’aere tenebroso si riversa; 12 pute la terra che questo riceve.
query.result:
**English:**
10 Large hail, dark water and snow 11 pour down through the gloomy air; 12 the earth that receives this stinks.
**Cornish:**
10 Menow meur, dowr tewl ha ergh 11 a-dreus an ebron dywyll; 12 breus yw an nor a wra dhemedhi.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
13 Cerbero, fiera crudele e diversa, 14 con tre gole caninamente latra 15 sovra la gente che quivi è sommersa.
query.result:
**English:**
13 Cerberus, cruel and diverse beast, 14 barks dog-like with three throats 15 over the people who are submerged here.
**Cornish:**
13 Kerberos, anial krueel ha dyffrans, 14 a latra moy es da dri golgas kyn, 15 war an bobel a yw kledhys ena.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
16 Li occhi ha vermigli, la barba unta e atra, 17 e ’l ventre largo, e unghiate le mani; 18 graffia li spirti ed iscoia ed isquatra.
query.result:
**English:**
16 His eyes are red, his beard greasy and black, 17 his belly is large, and his hands are clawed; 18 he scratches the spirits and flays and quarters them.
**Cornish:**
16 Y lygagh rudh, y varv lymm ha du, 17 ha'y voos bras, ha'y dhewynnygow klew; 18 ev a skraf an spyrysow ha'y a skoy ha'y a skwardra.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
22 Quando ci scorse Cerbero, il gran vermo, 23 le bocche aperse e mostrocci le sanne; 24 non avea membro che tenesse fermo.
query.result:
**English:**
22 When Cerberus, the great worm, saw us, 23 he opened his mouths and showed us his fangs; 24 he had no limb that he could keep still.
**Cornish:**
22 Pan wrug Cerberus, an wern meur, ni, 23 y genow a agoras ha'y a dhiskwedhas y dhens; 24 nyns esa esel na alla bos mar.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
25 E ’l duca mio distese le sue spanne, 26 prese la terra, e con piene le pugna 27 la gittò dentro a le bramose canne.
query.result:
**English:**
25 And my leader stretched out his hands, 26 took some earth, and with his fists full 27 threw it into the greedy reeds.
**Cornish:**
25 Ha'gas ow th'ew orth y'n dhewolgas, 26 kemer an nor, ha gans leun y'n dhewolgas, 27 y th'ew dhe'nwedha'n keunow an gorsow.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
28 Qual è quel cane ch’abbaiando agogna, 29 e si racqueta poi che ’l pasto morde, 30 ché solo a divorarlo intende e pugna,
31 cotai si fecer quelle facce lorde 32 de lo demonio Cerbero, che ’ntrona 33 l’anime sì, ch’esser vorrebber sorde.
query.result:
**English:**
28 Like a dog that barks with longing, 29 and then falls silent when he bites his food, 30 for he is intent only on devouring and fighting,
31 so did those filthy faces of 32 the demon Cerberus become, who deafens 33 the souls so that they would like to be deaf.
**Cornish:**
28 Kepar ki yw an ki hafle gans hira, 29 ha'gas sawya sawel pan vordh y'n boos, 30 rag yma yw y'n unnik orth ha bos,
31 keth yw anedha hwythow rudh 32 an deamon Cerberus, neb a sawya 33 an eneow, keth a vynnsa bos both.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
34 Noi passavam su per l’ombre che adona 35 la greve pioggia, e ponavam le piante 36 sovra lor vanità che par persona.
query.result:
**English:**
34 We passed over the shades that the heavy 35 rain prostrates, and we set our feet 36 upon their nothingness that seems a person.
**Cornish:**
34 Ni a drehedha war-tu an dellow a wra 35 an glaw trumm, ha ni a settya an tresow 36 war aga gwaskedhes a wra person.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
37 Elle giacean per terra tutte quante, 38 fuor d’una ch’a seder si levò, ratto 39 ch’ella ci vide passarsi davante.
query.result:
**English:**
37 They all lay on the ground, 38 except for one who stood up suddenly 39 when she saw us passing in front of her.
**Cornish:**
37 Yth esa ynwedhes war an nor, 38 mes onan a sevel a sevas, rat 39 pan wrug hy ny weles tremena davans.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
40 «O tu che se’ per questo ’nferno tratto», 41 mi disse, «riconoscimi, se sai: 42 tu fosti, prima ch’io disfatto, fatto».
query.result:
**English:**
40 "O you who are brought to this hell," 41 she said to me, "recognize me, if you can: 42 you were created before I was destroyed."
**Cornish:**
40 "O ty ow th’es rag an nor ma ma," 41 hi a leveris, "aswon vy, mar es gows: 42 ty a veu gwrys, kyns oen veu distruys."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
43 E io a lui: «L’angoscia che tu hai 44 forse ti tira fuor de la mia mente, 45 sì che non par ch’i’ ti vedessi mai.
query.result:
**English:**
43 And I to him: "The anguish that you have 44 perhaps draws you out of my mind, 45 so that it does not seem that I ever saw you.
**Cornish:**
43 Ha my a-dho: "An angoesh genowgh 44 mar pleg y'th omma a-dho'm genowgh, 45 mar nyns eus par henna vyth omma gwelys."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
46 Ma dimmi chi tu se’ che ’n sì dolente 47 loco se’ messo, e hai sì fatta pena, 48 che, s’altra è maggio, nulla è sì spiacente».
query.result:
**English:**
46 But tell me who you are, who in such a sorrowful 47 place have been put, and have such pain, 48 that if there is another greater, none is so distressing».
**Cornish:**
46 Mes dywedh pwy sy’vyth yn le mayn dolentow 47 le mayn le mayn tyller vyth settys, ha tyller vyth boen, 48 henna, gen vyth aral mayer, nyns eus neb mayn spyakentow».

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
49 Ed elli a me: «La tua città, ch’è piena 50 d’invidia sì che già trabocca il sacco, 51 seco mi tenne in la vita serena.
query.result:
**English:**
49 And he to me: "Your city, which is so full 50 of envy that the sack is already overflowing, 51 kept me with it in the serene life.
**Cornish:**
49 Ha henna dhymm: "Dha sita, neb a'gan leun 50 a-gan gonvedh bys vyth fyllir an sak, 51 a-dhas vyth keppys yn byw treus."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
52 Voi cittadini mi chiamaste Ciacco: 53 per la dannosa colpa de la gola, 54 come tu vedi, a la pioggia mi fiacco.
query.result:
**English:**
52 You citizens called me Ciacco: 53 for the harmful sin of gluttony, 54 as you see, I am weakened by the rain.
**Cornish:**
52 Whans a-dhis sita Ciacco a-vri vyth henwys: 53 rag an pechodh gwella a-gan gonvedh, 54 dell wels, y'm gwann dhe wlasow glaw.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
55 E io anima trista non son sola, 56 ché tutte queste a simil pena stanno 57 per simil colpa». E più non fé parola.
query.result:
**English:**
55 And I, a sad soul, am not alone, 56 for all these here are suffering a similar punishment 57 for a similar sin." And he said no more.
**Cornish:**
55 Ha my, eneval trist, nyns yw unnik, 56 rag an oll an re ma neb owth sufferi 57 rag pechodh keth. Ha nyns leveris moy.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
58 Io li rispuosi: «Ciacco, il tuo affanno 59 mi pesa sì, ch’a lagrimar mi ’nvita; 60 ma dimmi, se tu sai, a che verranno
61 li cittadin de la città partita; 62 s’alcun v’è giusto; e dimmi la cagione 63 per che l’ha tanta discordia assalita».
query.result:
**English:**
58 I answered him: "Ciacco, your suffering 59 weighs on me so much that it moves me to tears; 60 but tell me, if you know, what will become
61 of the citizens of the divided city; 62 is there any just one among them; and tell me the reason 63 why such great discord has assailed it".
**Cornish:**
58 Yth ofennavos: "Ciacco, dha boen 59 a wra dhemmyn vy, ow pyth vy dhegrysi; 60 mes dywedh vy, mar ow tys, pyth vydh dhe
61 bagasow a'n cita dhaskorrys; 62 ow yw unn gwiryon y'ga; ha dywedh vy dhemmyn 63 rag pyth yw kemmys a angoras owth assalli".

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
64 E quelli a me: «Dopo lunga tencione 65 verranno al sangue, e la parte selvaggia 66 caccerà l’altra con molta offensione.
query.result:
**English:**
64 And those to me: "After a long contention 65 they will come to blood, and the savage party 66 will chase the other with much offense.
**Cornish:**
64 Ha'gasowdhyn: "Wosa hir sparra 65 ymons y'gan gwydh, ha'n rannwydh gwyls 66 a wra'gas an aral gans meur offis."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
67 Poi appresso convien che questa caggia 68 infra tre soli, e che l’altra sormonti 69 con la forza di tal che testé piaggia.
query.result:
**English:**
67 Then it is necessary that this one fall 68 within three suns, and that the other rise 69 with the force of one who is now descending.
**Cornish:**
67 Wosa henna ywredya dell yw fetha 68 bys yn tressaul, ha’n aral a wra dhegor 69 gans nerth an hini a wra yn kodha.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
70 Alte terrà lungo tempo le fronti, 71 tenendo l’altra sotto gravi pesi, 72 come che di ciò pianga o che n’aonti.
query.result:
**English:**
70 For a long time they will keep their foreheads bowed, 71 bearing the other under heavy weights, 72 so that it weeps or groans about it.
**Cornish:**
70 Rag hir a wra veur aga frontow, 71 ow tos an aral dhyworth pyson, 72 mar plyw aga henna po gow po onan.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
73 Giusti son due, e non vi sono intesi; 74 superbia, invidia e avarizia sono 75 le tre faville c’hanno i cuori accesi».
query.result:
**English:**
73 Two are just, and they are not heard; 74 pride, envy, and avarice are 75 the three sparks that have set hearts aflame.
**Cornish:**
73 Dhew yw jyst, ha nen ev eus klevys; 74 breus, gonעס, ha gwyth yw 75 an teyr sparkow a wra tanow colon.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
76 Qui puose fine al lagrimabil suono. 77 E io a lui: «Ancor vo’ che mi ’nsegni 78 e che di più parlar mi facci dono.
query.result:
**English:**
76 Here he put an end to the tearful sound. 77 And I to him: "I still want you to teach me 78 and to grant me the gift of further speech.
**Cornish:**
76 Ena a wrug gorfenna dhe'n son trist. 77 Ha my a-dho: "Vyth a vynnaf vy dhysky. 78 Ha mos a-wra kov dhe'n ger lavarow."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
79 Farinata e ’l Tegghiaio, che fuor sì degni, 80 Iacopo Rusticucci, Arrigo e ’l Mosca 81 e li altri ch’a ben far puoser li ’ngegni,
82 dimmi ove sono e fa ch’io li conosca; 83 ché gran disio mi stringe di savere 84 se ’l ciel li addolcia o lo ’nferno li attosca».
query.result:
**English:**
79 Farinata and Tegghiaio, who were so worthy, 80 Jacopo Rusticucci, Arrigo and Mosca, 81 and the others who applied their minds to doing good,
82 tell me where they are and let me know them; 83 for a great desire constrains me to know 84 if Heaven sweetens them or Hell embitters them.
**Cornish:**
79 Farinata ha'n Tegghiaio, o veu mor dhyn, 80 Iacopo Rusticucci, Arrigo ha'n Mosca 81 ha'n re erel a wrug aga sperys dhe wul ober,
82 lever vy dhe'n eus ha'gas vy'm aswon; 83 rag muns krev bras yw dhe wodhya 84 po'th yw an nef a wra aga melyon po an ifern aga venena.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
85 E quelli: «Ei son tra l’anime più nere; 86 diverse colpe giù li grava al fondo: 87 se tanto scendi, là i potrai vedere.

Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
88 Ma quando tu sarai nel dolce mondo, 89 priegoti ch’a la mente altrui mi rechi: 90 più non ti dico e più non ti rispondo».
query.result:
**English:**
88 But when you are in the sweet world, 89 I beg you to bring me to the minds of others: 90 I say no more to you and answer you no more."
**Cornish:**
88 Mes pan vyth yn an bys da, 89 y'm gows orth agas ow th'y'm koweth: 90 nyns yw moy ha bos ha nyns yw moy owth atteb orth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
91 Li diritti occhi torse allora in biechi; 92 guardommi un poco e poi chinò la testa: 93 cadde con essa a par de li altri ciechi.
query.result:
**English:**
91 Then he turned his righteous eyes askance; 92 he looked at me a little and then bowed his head: 93 with it he fell beside the other blind men.
**Cornish:**
91 An gwella golwg eth omladha orth y'n drog; 92 y'm gwelas moy un tamm ha wosa eth y'n ben: 93 hag eth henna y'n kodha gans an erel dall.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
94 E ’l duca disse a me: «Più non si desta 95 di qua dal suon de l’angelica tromba, 96 quando verrà la nimica podesta:
97 ciascun rivederà la trista tomba, 98 ripiglierà sua carne e sua figura, 99 udirà quel ch’in etterno rimbomba».
query.result:
**English:**
94 And the leader said to me: "He will not awaken again 95 from this side of the sound of the angelic trumpet, 96 when the enemy power will come:
97 each one will see again the sad tomb, 98 will take again his flesh and his form, 99 will hear that which resounds eternally."
**Cornish:**
94 Ha'n dyghow a lever orth bysma 95 a-dhia ow orth son an trompas a'n els, 96 pan dheuth an gallusow gostewas:
97 pub onan a welo an bez marow trist, 98 y'n kemer y'n korf ha'y furv, 99 y'n klevos henna a wra sona bys vyth.

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
106 Ed elli a me: «Ritorna a tua scïenza, 107 che vuol, quanto la cosa è più perfetta, 108 più senta il bene, e così la doglienza.
query.result:
**English:**
106 And he said to me: "Return to your knowledge, 107 which wills that, the more perfect a thing is, 108 the more it feels pleasure, and thus pain."
**Cornish:**
106 Ha henna dhymm: "Drehedhy dhe'th skians, 107 henna a vyn, vel moy a wra an pyth perffaith, 108 moy a vyn an gwelow, ha'gawra an dowlens."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
109 Tutto che questa gente maladetta 110 in vera perfezion già mai non vada, 111 di là più che di qua essere aspetta».
query.result:
**English:**
109 Although all these cursed people 110 may never attain true perfection, 111 they expect to be better off there than here."
**Cornish:**
109 Erbynn an pobel drwg ma 110 yn perfayth gwir na wra vyth byth, 111 moy a wra gwell eno ages na'gawra."

query.prompt:
Please translate each line literally into English and Cornish.
112 Noi aggirammo a tondo quella strada, 113 parlando più assai ch’i’ non ridico; 114 venimmo al punto dove si digrada:
115 quivi trovammo Pluto, il gran nemico.
query.result:
**English:**
112 We circled around that road, 113 talking much more than I can tell; 114 we came to the point where it descends:
115 there we found Pluto, the great enemy.
**Cornish:**
112 Ni a droedhyas a-dro dhe'n fordh na, 113 ow kewsel moy ages na'm'i lever, 114 ni a dheuth dhe'n poynt le mayth aswon:
115 eno ni a gavas Pluto, an enebes bras.
